content: scarlett s reversible cable baby blanket by suzanne bryan both sides of this blanket show the right side of the cables there is no wrong side intermediate experience level finished measurements 36 x 36 90cm x 90cm materials cascade yarns 220 superwash 100% wool 220 yards / 100 grams or equivalent weight yarn 7 skeins color 1940 peach us 7 4 5 mm needles or size needed to obtain gauge cable needle optional tapestry needle gauge 26 sts and 32 row over 4 /10cm in cable stitch pattern to save time take time to check gauge © suzanne bryan 2013 �1 special abbreviations special techniques 2/2rc sl 2 sts to cn hold to back k2 k2 from cn cabling without a cable needle 2/2 rpc sl 2 sts to cn hold to back p2 p2 from cn place rt needle into fronts of the 3rd and 4th sts puff&b purl into the front of the next st leaving the st on the left needle on the left needle purl into the back remove st holding the 4 sts on the left needle between from left needle your fingers remove the left needle from the seed stitch pattern back reinsert the left needle into the two right stitches place the two stitches on the right multiple of 2 + 1 needle onto the left needle for row 4 these all row *k1 p1 repeat from * k1 stitches will be knit and for row 8 these stitches cable stitch pattern will be purled see video at http //youtu be/bafsbr54nt4 multiple of 8 + 4 row 1 3 5 & 7 ws *p4 k4 repeat from * p4 row 2 & 6 rs *k4 p4 repeat from * k4 row 4 *2/2rc p4 repeat from * 2/2rc row 8 *k4 2/2rpc repeat from * k4 blanket directions co 175 sts work in seed stitch pattern for 1 increase row rs work in seed stitch pattern for 5 sts *k2 kf&b p2 puff&b repeat from * until 8 sts rem k2 kf&b work in seed stitch pattern for rem 5 sts 230 sts maintaining the first and last 5 sts in seed stitch pattern work cable stitch pattern over center 220 sts until piece measures 35 in length decrease row k1 p1 twice k1 *p1 k1 p2tog k1 p1 k2tog repeat from * until 5 sts rem k1 p1 twice k1 work 1 in seed stitch pattern bobble in pattern weave in ends and block suzanne bryan is a tkga certified master hand knitter and is currently a co-chair on the master hand knitting committee she teaches classes for her local guild what the knit as well as at the knit & crochet shows she has written many articles and patterns for cast on magazine you can find her on ravelry as knittingsuzanne © suzanne bryan 2013 �2
